intro: Acer nikoense var. griseum, commonly known as the Japanese maple with silver leaves, is a deciduous tree native to Japan. It is characterized by its distinctive, finely serrated leaves that turn a striking bronze-red in the fall. The plant belongs to the Sapindaceae family and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. It typically grows to a height of 6–10 meters and prefers well-drained, acidic soil. Its unique foliage makes it a popular choice for landscape design in temperate climates.
